intro: Betonica leiocalyx, commonly known as the lesser betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as mint and sage. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. Betonica leiocalyx is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in partial shade. Its medicinal properties have been historically used in traditional herbal remedies.
